description.narrative: The objective of the Fiscal Management Development Project for Gambia is to increase fiscal space and improve effectiveness of public resources management. The Project has three components. 1. Strengthening revenue collection and public procurement processes component will increase fiscal space, the efficiency of public expenditure and support business continuity in this Corona Virus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) pandemic. This component has four subcomponents. 1.1. Strengthening the Gambia Revenue Authority's tax administration processes and digital transformation subcomponent will enhance the GRA's operational effectiveness and achieving digital transformation; it will also support comprehensive tax compliance risk management processes based on international good practices. 1.2. Strengthening the capacity of Ministry of Finance and Economic Affairs (MoFEA) for tax policy development and oversight subcomponent will strengthen tax policy formulation and the overall policy regime for revenue collection. 1.3. Enhancing taxpayer services and providing mobile solutions to individual, micro and small taxpayers subcomponent will support online transactions (filing and payment) with GRA using mobile devices, to which most individual, micro and small taxpayers have access. 1.4. Strengthening the public procurement function subcomponent will support activities to promote an enhanced public sector procurement management framework, facilitated through online information processes, helping to improve budget execution. 2. Supporting fiscal management of State-Owned Enterprises and restructuring plans of telecoms SOEs component combines results-based financing (RBF), linking disbursements to the achievement of agreed upon performance indicators and Technical Assistance (TA). Subcomponent 2.1. Fiscal Risk Assessment and Performance Monitoring will support the operationalization of a Centr

condition.narrative: Schedule 2, Section III,C. The Recipient shall, not later than six (6) months after the Effective Date, appoint an external auditoron terms and conditions acceptable to the Association. The terms and conditions shall include, inter alia, the requirement to actas a third-party verifier of the proper fulfillment of the DLI and DLRs set forth in Schedule 3 to this Agreement (“IndependentVerification Agent”). To this end, the Recipient shall cause the external auditor to carry out, prior to each Withdrawal anassessment of the fulfillment of each DLI and DLR as set forth in Schedule 3 to this Agreement, and provide to the Recipient andthe Association an EEP Spending and Results Report containing, inter alia, said assessment on each DLI and DLR fulfillment and aproposal for disbursement under each Withdrawal

Schedule 2, Section III,C. The Recipient shall, not later than three (3) months after the Effective Date, acquire and installadequate accounting software, in form and substance acceptable to the Association

Schedule 2, Section III,C. The Recipient shall, through the DPPP&PE, not later than three (3) months after the Effective Date, signa Memorandum of Understanding with the Internal Audit Directorate on the carrying out of internal audit reviews under the Projecton a semester basis

title.narrative: Performance contracts signed with the main corporatized State-Owned Enterprises
Comprehensive SOE Bill including adequate institutional framework

baseline.value: Current legal and institutional framework is characterized by a level of confusion and a fragmented oversight function

target.value: SOE Act adopted with implementing regulations

title.narrative: Performance audit reports of SOE prepared by the National Audit Office and discussed with the Public Enterprises Committee of the National Assembly and published on the website of the MoICI (DLR2)
Electronic and Mobile Services for Large and Medium Taxpayers
Value Added Tax (VAT) Gross compliance ratio
Share of active large taxpayers paying VAT on time
GRA operational staff are qualified and deployed for field audits
A centralized oversight agency (SOE Commission), has been established and operationalized with required staffing to monitor financial and operational performance of the SOEs in its portfolio (DLR.1)
Aggregate annual SOEs report prepared and published by the centralized oversight agency (SOE Commission)
Adoption of a tax expenditure policy
Certified procurement professionals in the procuring organizations
Certified women procurement professionals in the procuring organizations
Rolling out e-GP in pilot ministries
Share of competitive biddings for procuring organizations using electronic Government Procurement (e-GP)
